page.title: 04The Windmills
page.content: Thurleigh was a fine tower mill of the Lincolnshire type. The height to the top was 60ft.. There were five floors in total. On the second floor there are two pairs of stones and the remains of a wire machine. The brakewheel which was made of wood and is nine foot across is still visible. One sail was blown off in 1917 and the other three plus the ironwork and the gearing were removed in 1940 to help the war effort. Planning permission has now been granted for the mill to be used as the central tower of a house. The other windmill used to be adjacent to 16, Keysoe Road, but there are no remains of it at all now.
